𓈋 the peculiar ambivalent dual is captured in one word for 𓈋⋍bridge : *qʷəmbər- “beam” qʷambi
𓈋 𓆭 tree timber amber

In South Arabic, the language in use in the southern portion of the Arabian Peninsula at the time of Muhammad, the b and m were interchangeable.

Theory:
Around Göbekli, three cultures and said :
* mpa=father mbat=mother (t as feminine) Semitic => ma=father pa=mother @Caucasian m𓌸pa> 𐤀𐤁 (ʾb) um.pa!
* mbat=father mbata=mother (a as feminine) Semitic => Arab (see below) Shem=>Ham እባት m ʾəbat => 𒀜 abu
* pata=father mata=mother (mb split) Japhet (PIE)
